org.edg.data.replication.optorsim.optor
Interface Optimisable

All Known Implementing Classes:
EcoBinModelOptimiser, EconomicModelOptimiser, EcoZipfModelOptimiser, LfuOptimiser, LruOptimiser, ReplicatingOptimiser, SimpleOptimiser, SkelOptor
public interface Optimisable

This interface must be implemented by all replica optimiser classes. Each optimiser should define its own implementation of getBestFile(java.lang.String[], float[]). This is the method called whenever a file request is made. It determines where the best replica of a file is and most implementations may perform replication of files within this method.

Copyright (c) 2004 CERN, ITC-irst, PPARC, on behalf of the EU DataGrid. For license conditions see LICENSE file or http://www.edg.org/license.html

Since:
JDK1.4

Method Detail

getAccessCost

float getAccessCost(java.lang.String[] lfn,
                    ComputingElement ce,
                    float[] fileFraction)
Returns the cost for accessing the files whose names are specified by the array lfn from the Computing Element specified by ce.

Parameters:
lfn - The names of the files required for the job.
ce - The Computing Element for which the access cost is calculated.
fileFraction - The fractions of each file required for the job.
Returns:
The cost in terms of time to access all the best replicas needed for the job.

initFilePrefetch

void initFilePrefetch(java.lang.String[] lfn,
                      ComputingElement ce)
Non-blocking getBestFile(). Not yet implemented in OptorSim.

cancelFilePrefetch

void cancelFilePrefetch(java.lang.String[] lfn,
                        ComputingElement ce)
Cancels initFilePrefetch(). Not yet implemented in OptorSim.

getBestFile

DataFile[] getBestFile(java.lang.String[] lfn,
                       float[] fileFraction)
Returns a DataFile array, possibly after some replication has occurred. Computing Elements call this method to find the best replicas of each file to access.

Parameters:
lfn - The name of the files the CE needs to access.
fileFraction - The fraction of each file the CE uses. This can be important in deciding whether it is better to replicate a file or read it remotely.
Returns:
The DataFiles the CE will access.
